summary:
## Beluga Whales: An Arctic Delight

Beluga whales are white, Arctic whales known for their high-pitched calls and lack of a dorsal fin. They're excellent swimmers and divers, living in groups of around 10. Belugas are migratory, moving to warmer waters in summer.

Historically hunted, they face threats from pollution, climate change, and disease. Some populations are endangered.  Belugas are popular in aquariums due to their friendly appearance and intelligence.
title: Beluga whale
